meanings.definition: To a considerable extent or degree.
meanings.sent1: She sizeably improved her grades after studying hard.
meanings.sent2: The team sizeably outperformed their opponents in the championship.
meanings.sent3: The cat sizeably increased its speed when chasing the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His confidence sizeably grew as he faced his fears head-on.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden sizeably bloomed after the rain shower.

meanings.definition: In a way that is large in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The cake sizeably filled the entire plate.
meanings.sent2: The storm sizeably damaged the old barn.
meanings.sent3: The toddler sizeably stacked blocks to build a tower.
meanings.sent4: The mountain loomed sizeably in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The crowd sizeably cheered as the fireworks lit up the sky.
